qualifications: Leaks & Watts  Youth Counselor Bachelors Degree, 1 -2 years work experience.  Serves as direct youth supervisor with responsibility for the safety, personal conduct, care, and therapy of the youth.  Provides eyes=on supervision of youth; Implements group and individual treatment plans; intervenes during emergencies or altercations to maintain physical control of youth.  Supervises, counsels and implements natural consequences to youth per facility policy and procedures.  Supervises movement of youth inside and outside the facility; takes periodic counts of youth.  Supervises youth in a residential juvenile justice facility in the performance of activities and during recreational and various other program  activities: (I.e. school, homework, arts, phase activates, independent living, home visits, religious etc.)  Conducts personal and facility searches for contraband and facility inspections for health and safety hazards.  Assume the responsibility of successfully taking AMAP/Medication  Administration, passing the course and administering medication as needed.  Assume the responsibility for successfully taking and passing the designated crisis management and physical safety intervention technique training (including any refresher and recertification trainings and examinations)  Successfully completes all required trainings.  Preparing and serving meals for the youth as needed (primarily on weekends and mornings as well as when the cook is out)                          Leaks & Watts  Aftercare Resource/Education Specialist Bachelors Degree in Social Work, Counseling, Education, or other relevant field.  Evaluate the educational history, academic strengths and weaknesses, need for or history of an Individualized Educations Plan ( IEP), educational goals and preferences for adult life.  Ensure youth is placed in appropriate educational setting and support the family in advocating for any changes necessary.  Engage youth, primary caregiver other key participants to be a part of the change process in congruence with the fundamental beliefs and goals of the FFT evidence-basked model (Family-focused, strength-based).   Collaborate with school districts to ensure that program goals and IEP goals align and that youth receive all necessary support.  Obtain weekly attendance reports for all youth.   Assist youth with key educational transitions, such as preparation for high school or post-secondary education applications.  Refer youth and families to pro social activities including formal and informal supports as deemed necessary. Participate in all agency, ACS/JJI and FFT model program training, individual supervision and group consultation activities.  Attend ACS Education committee meetings.  Other duties as assigned. Community Action  Direct Support Professional High School Diploma/Ged required Assist residents with self-care, toileting, showering, tooth brushing, grooming, dressing and ensure proper hygiene and prepare meals for consumers as needed.  Assist residents with appropriate eating and drinking skills and table managers.  Assist residents in attaining skills needed for daily living and socialization according to their abilities.  Assist residents in maintenance of rooms, clothing and personal possessions.  Meal preparation.   AHRC -  Direct Support Professional High School Diploma or Equivalent.  Minimum of six months experience working with people with developmental disabilities or direct experience as an HHA, PCA, and CNA (preferred).  Education in a related field in lieu of experience will be considered.  Background screening is required including OPWDD fingerprinting.
